content:
{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-075-23-B |Item_parent=Smoking addiction |Item_parent_short=Smoking addiction |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the diagnosis of psychiatric and addictive co-morbidities |Description=To know the frequent co-morbidity of psychiatric and addictive disorders; Ref. introductory item 74-79 |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=23}} * Smoking may promote panic disorder * Significant smoking comorbidity in patients with psychiatric disorders ** Schizophrenia 82% of smokers ** Bipolar disorder 56% smokers * Before giving up smoking, look for anxiety disorders and depressive episodes. * Links between difficulty quitting and depressive symptoms
* Manifestations of anxiety and depression induced by withdrawal: ** If lasting a few weeks => no pharmacological treatment but support in consultation ** Beyond that => specific psychiatric treatment * After withdrawal, improvement in anxiety and depressive symptoms and quality of life.

question.title: What is a common comorbidity with smoking addiction?
question.description: What is a frequent comorbidity of psychiatric and addictive disorders?

option_a.title: Schizophrenia
option_a.description: A severe mental disorder that affects 1 in 100 people

option_b.title: Bipolar disorder
option_b.description: A mood disorder that affects a person's mood and energy levels

option_c.title: Depressive disorder
option_c.description: A mental health condition characterized by persistent sadness and loss of interest

option_d.title: Anxiety disorder
option_d.description: A mental health condition characterized by excessive worry and fear

correct_option.title: Schizophrenia
correct_option.description: A mental disorder that is often comorbid with smoking addiction
